title: Instructional Designers' Philosophical Beliefs and Their Application in Social Studies Curriculum Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in social studies and proficiency in digital tools
context.additional_context: Learners explore social studies curriculum design principles based on administrative/management job experiences and engage in blended learning using personal devices (BYOD).

learning_goals: Ability to apply and explain the concepts of ontology (realism/relativism) and epistemology (empiricism/rationalism) in instructional design to social studies subject cases
Ability to analyze the impact of axiological beliefs, such as value neutrality/ethical realism, when designing social studies curricula
Understanding the philosophical foundations of quantitative/qualitative methodologies and selecting appropriate methodological approaches for social studies assessment design

resources: Philosophy of Social Science Inventory (PSSI) Survey Instrument

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
